The interior is in fairly good shape as well.  Some of the faux wood has started peeling but the seats, door panels, dash and carpet are all good otherwise.  This would make a great driver or a car that can have the minor imperfections taken care of and have an extremely nice car. Come down and check this one out today!
title: 1982 Studebaker Avanti

description: For sale in our Orlando Florida showroom is a 1964  Studebaker Champ Pickup. The Studebaker Champ was a light-duty pickup truck produced by the Studebaker Corporation from 1960-1964. The chassis and cargo box of the Champ were basically the same as what had been used for Studebaker's Ã‚Â½ and Ã‚Â¾-ton trucks since 1949, but the cab section was very different. An entirely new cab was out of the question because of cost considerations, but the new Lark compact car's body proved to be just the right size and shape to suit the purpose. The engineering staff took a four-door sedan, cut it in half behind the front doors and modified the front half slightly to fit the truck chassis. The only new sheetmetal stamping that was required was the back wall of the new cab. Minor modifications for mounting of the cab to the 1949-vintage truck frame were also made.The Lark's front end sheetmetal was retained as well, but funds were allocated to give the Champ a new horizontal-bar grille that delivered a "tougher" look From the start of production, those desiring V8 power could choose between Studebaker's 259- and 289 inÃ‚Â³ engines with either a two- or four-barrel carburetor. Both engines remained largely unchanged during the truck's production run. A wide variety of transmissions, both manual and automatic, were available in Champs. Base models came with a three-speed column shifted manual (AKA: 3 on the tree). Today, the Champs that still exist are highly prized for their interesting combination of passenger-car comfort and style and their rugged mechanical durability For more HD pictures and video visit http://www.gatewayclassiccars.com/orlando/1964/studebaker/champ-S719.htmll. For more information about this truck call our Orlando Florida Showroom at 407-771-2000.or email us at Orlando@gatewayclassiccars.com - See more at: http://www.gatewayclassiccars.com/orlando/1964/studebaker/champ-S719.html
title: 1964 Studebaker Champion

description: This is a 1 family owned, very dry car purchased new in Southern California. The GT Hawk's styling was a fairly radical face lift by designer Brooks Stevens of the older Hawk shape; Stevens went after a European-inspired, clean look for the car he code named the "Hawk Monaco" . This car features a 289 Packard V8 engine, a manual 3 speed on the column, AM/FM CD stereo, A/C upgraded with a late model compressor and R134 Freon, the interior has been redone to a tan leather that is flame retardant (the same material used in United airlines cockpits) and has been repainted red. This car runs and drives great!
title: 1962 Studebaker Hawk

description: 1963 Studebaker Gran Turisimo Hawk  For 1963 the car was slightly restyled, with refinements to the front, sides, and rear. Round parking lights below the headlights replaced the previous rectangular ones, set into the corners of the newly closed side grilles that bore a squared pattern of lines over fine mesh. Beginning with the 1963 model year, the "Jet Thrust" R-series V-8 engines designed for the Avanti could be ordered throughout the Studebaker line, with the naturally aspirated R1 delivering 240 bhp.  This GT Hawk is finished in a deep red over a black and white interior. The chrome trim and grille are in excellent condition. The car featuers power steering and brakes, air conditioning, bucket sets and center console and a full set of gauges including tachometer.  It is powered by the 289 cu in V-8 and 3 speed automatic transmission.
title: 1963 Studebaker Hawk

description: 1963 Studebaker Avanti R-1 First year car with round headlights, originally titled in California as a 1964. 289 R-1 V8 - 4bbl, automatic transmission, air conditioning (not working), power steering and disc brakes, original radio. Nice condition with older Avanti Gold repaint and fawn/black interior. Factory engine was rebuilt and blueprinted in the '90's and driven about 30,000 miles since. Pristine torque boxes. Recent caliper seals and pads, new alternator, regulator and battery. Car has been shown locally numerous times and is in good running order Extensive documentation, build sheet, shop manuals and parts catalogs are included. I am the fourth owner for more than 20 years and must sell after losing garage space.
title: 1963 Studebaker Avanti

description: The 1963 STUDEBAKER GRAN TURISMO HAWK for sale here is a direct descendant of the Fabulous 1953 Loewy Coupe one of the most significant automobile designs of that decade Updated by Brooks Stevens, the powerful Hawk GT was one of the first personal luxury automobiles and was espoused in ads featuring famous connoisseur and Rolls-Royce Owner Lucius Beebe, former chairman of the Pebble Beach road races and author of the book "The Big Spenders". The GT Hawk achieved certified milestone car status long ago. With only a few thousand units built for 1963, It's a rare All-American Classic of the most desirable kind. This fantastic '63 STUDEBAKER GRAN TURISMO HAWK comes with an irrepressible 289 cubic inch solid lifter V-8 Power plant with Dual Exhaust. The Hawk's body is free of dings and dents original black with a pearl interior. All bright work and trim are in place throughout. The trunk is solid with the original spare the real nice original interior and seats all original! Dashboard is in unaltered factory condition. In addition to the engine work, there is a rebuilt transmission, a restored gas tank, new voltage regulator, fuel pump, brakes, restored radiator, rebuilt starter, new battery.
title: 1963 Studebaker Hawk

description: For sale in our Nashville showroom is a 1970 Studebaker Avanti II. This 1970 Avanti II for sale is the ultimate trivia question, Ã¢??What car has a small block Chevy, seats only two and has a fiberglass body?Ã¢?Â Everyone will answer, Corvette but you and I know that the Avanti meets all those same points. Light weight, strong engine and styling that is unlike anything else. WhatÃ¢??s not to like?  The styling of this car is what separates it from the crowd and this car owes its lines to three designers Raymond Loewy, Robert Andrews and Tom Kellogg.  As the story goes these three men spent less than a month with an idea, pencil, paper and clay sequestered themselves in a home in Palm Springs and designed this car. Their idea, not one flat panel everything had to have compound curves and very little chrome. They felt that chrome was basically over after the lavish use of it in the fifties. So this car is the end result and I think it is incredible. It is one of those few cars that grabs you by the eye balls and makes you look at it, makes you want it. This 1970 Avanti for sale is a great example, the body is in great shape, engine pumps out more than enough power, transmission shifts tight and right. It handles well and the interior looks almost new. So if you ever wanted a car that made even some car people ask Ã¢??what kind of car is that?Ã¢?Â Then this is your next car and you can look at them and say, Ã¢??ItÃ¢??s an Avanti that means forward in ItalianÃ¢?Â It is also nice that it is a blast to drive, remember, small block Chevrolet with a light weight fiberglass body! It has been a winning combination for decades! Options for this 1970 Studebaker for sale include: Air conditioning, AM/FM cassette, Power steering and brakes, Tilt steering wheel, Seat belts, Leather interior, Wire wheels and radial tires. For more information about the Studebaker Avanti II for sale call the Nashville showroom at 615-213-1800 or email us at nashville@gatewayclassiccars.com
title: 1970 Studebaker Avanti

description: In the early '60s, Studebaker needed a new truck to stay viable but didn't have the money to build one. The solution? The Champ, which took the existing pickup chassis and bed and grafted on a Lark front end, creating one of the coolest pickups of the decade. This 1961 Studebaker Champ pickup is mildly modified, creating a fascinating hybrid in more than a few ways.

The guy who built this truck was resourceful, we'll give him that. Starting with a Studebaker Champ is one thing, but then adding a '70s Camaro front clip, Dodge power, a Toyota seat, and a few other modern bits makes it really unique. The paint was probably done when the truck was built, and that was some years ago, so it looks the way an old truck should look. It's a little faded, there are some scratches and nicks on the bodywork, and a few areas have been touched up, but isn't that how a pickup is supposed to look? Perfection is nice, but it also renders the pickup useless as a tool, and this one has no such pretensions. The Lark nose has a rugged look that's instantly familiar and the bed with its flared rear fenders looks aggressive but also neatly styled, and we can't say the look isn't appealing. The rear bumper was removed, but it still carries its original 'STUDEBAKER' tailgate and the bed inside remarkably carries a drop-in bedliner so it's still ready to work.

The interior carries that aforementioned Toyota bench seat, but you can quickly see why it was selected. One, it looks right and two, there's a neat cut-out for the shifter on the floor, making this Champ feel sporty. A late-model GM tilt column and Grant GT steering wheel make it easy to get comfortable and the upright cab, which was essentially the front half of a Lark 4-door sedan, offers plenty of head room. Rubber mats protect the carpets, and the factory gauges look cool in their own round pods. There's heat under the dash, but otherwise this pickup is still as basic as it was when it was new, which, again, is why everyone loves old trucks, right? Get in and go, no worries.

There's plenty of power on tap from a 318 cubic inch Dodge V8 and it looks right at home in the Stude's engine bay. Finned valve covers and a chrome air cleaner are traditional ways to dress things up, and there's a new alternator down there, suggesting that someone wanted this truck reliable. It's basic, but they ensured reliability with a 4-barrel carburetor, dual reservoir master cylinder, and a giant radiator up front, so you shouldn't be afraid to take this one for a spin any time. Underneath, it has the aforementioned Camaro front subframe, complete with front disc brakes, and the transmission is a Chrysler 904 3-speed automatic. A two-in, two-out Flowmaster muffler gives it a nice V8 burgle and the suspension is simple and rugged, with leaf springs holding up a late-model rear end on lowering blocks, so it has a nice stance. GM Rally wheels with spinners fit well and look great with fat 215/70/15 fron
title: 1961 Studebaker Champion

description: The Avanti II is a car that has a lot of heritage to it and a past that reflects the Studebaker lineup along with the newer Ford Mustang drivetrain and powertrain.  The company was bought and sold several times until being put to rest in 2006 with its last headquarters in Cancun Mexico.

Offered here is a vehicle for someone that wants to be unique but also likes to tinker and play with a car that could have some serious upside.  Very few of these remain on the roads and the interior of this one is very nice with lots of recent upgrades and replacement parts.  The paint has its given patina and the brakes will need some work.  These cars are an instant classic and gets attention where ever you may bring it.  Vehicle has power steering, power windows, leather seats, A/C, wood trim, white wall tires, fog lights, V8 and stereo.
To see over 80 photos of this car, including under carriage please visit our website www.grautogallery.com
